review_title: Stability, but not very progressive for everyone.
pros:
- stability
- free weekends
- not much overtime hours 
- foreign contracts
- international conferences
cons:
- special procedures for everything
- not flexible working hours
- hard to get finances for trainings etc.
- not very progressive
- many signatures for everything

pros: Very low salary for such high qualifications and requirements. The cost of renting an apartment in Cracow consumes about 50% of the salary. Overtime is not paid. Very cumbersome and time-consuming administrative procedures take up most of the time, resulting in less time for creative work and development.
cons: In general, the atmosphere is quite friendly. Raising funds for one's own research projects slightly improves the financial situation. Flexible working hours for a researcher can be considered an asset. High-speed Internet connection and reasonably good access to scientific journal databases. The institute has research tools that are unique in the country. Cooperation with foreign research centers.

pros: Located in Krakow, which is a vibrant city.
cons: Low salary with no raise for years.

pros: Friendly and encouraging atmosphere. Helpful staff and administration. Indications (surveys and institutional reports) that institute leadership takes seriously the topics of inclusion, diversity, bullying/harassment, etc.
cons: Institute (and commune) administration is incredibly difficult if you cannot speak Polish ...
